DataElement.preferredName: Patient Recurrent Disease Locally Advanced Malignant Neoplasm Unresectable Metastatic Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to whether the patient has recurrent, locally advanced, unresectable or metastatic disease as a criteria required to be eligible to participate in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Recurrent Disease Locally Advanced Malignant Neoplasm Unresectable Metastatic Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._The return of a disease after a period of remission._A malignant neoplasm that has spread from its original site of growth to nearby tissues or lymph nodes._Not capable of being removed by surgery._A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site._In clinical trials, requirements that must be met for a person to be included in a trial. These requirements help make sure that participants in a trial are like each other in terms of specific factors such as age, type and stage of cancer, general health, and previous treatment. When all participants meet the same eligibility criteria, it is more likely that results of the study are caused by the intervention being tested and not by other factors or by chance.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Recurrent Disease Locally Advanced Malignant Neoplasm Unresectable Metastatic Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.:Cancer that has spread from where it started to nearby tissue or lymph nodes.:Unable to be removed with surgery.:A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.
A malignant neoplasm that has spread from its original site of growth to nearby tissues or lymph nodes.
Not capable of being removed by surgery.
A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 12/3/2020: CM Released as part of draft content review

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
